content.description: Figured I would add this since the the first one was already online.  Start as for Big Joe, down low in the cave, climb Big Joe and traverse down and left into Weed, Whiskey and Women. LONG
content.location: Sit start to Big Joe and climb all the way into Profit in a Ditch

content.description: Climb Smokin' Joe and continue to traverse right and mantle out of the hole.
Climb straight up the southeast face of the Scary Monsters Boulder using jugs and positive edges.

Start on two good underclings with mediocre feet, slap left a couple of times out of the roof, then move up and right to a finishing jug.  The first move is really powerful and the rest of the sequence often involves campusing and some tricky heel hooks.

An alternate ending makes two more moves up and left to the jug with the pine tree in it, and adds a bit to the diffiuclty.
content.location: Just to the right of Big Joe, on the right side of the cave on the Big Joe boulder.

content.description: SDS with two pockets and work up and right through a sloping rail.  Slap left to a marginal sloper and use whatever else to stand up on the bulge.  There is a crack system that brings one to the top but the rock quality is questionable.  Most people hop off from the big hueco bucket.
SS in the underclings. Climb up the slippery, glued crimps to the sandy hole up top. Some guy from Provo glued the holds and Steven named it "Provo Gluru" to make fun of the guy.
content.location: right 5 ft of Techno Beat V4

content.description:
A little spicy!

Climb the face to a cruxy topout on sloping crimps.  The landing is good but you won't want to come off at the top.
content.location: Up the hill from the Big Joe boulder.  Walk up the trail to the boulder sitting right above the large waterfall ampitheater.

content.description: Literally in a ditch. SS in the very back of the cave on two underclings. Make a hard move out left with a gaston. Move feet and stand up while bringing your right hand in to be matched with your left. Move out the roof to the top and top out. A one star V5 variation starts in the middle of the roof on underclings.
content.location: the farthest right problem (away from Techno Beat V4) on the Big Joe roof

content.description: This adds a more logical finish to Big Joe by continuing through a few more tough holds and a flying dyno to the huge jug at the top of the cave.
content.location: Extension of Big Joe, on the Big Joe boulder.

content.description: Begin on top of the rock left of South Slab.  Climb the face using the left leaning crack.  Rock quality is questionable.
content.protection: Crash pad or two and think gentle.

content.description: Great overhanging roofy/crimp line.  A line straight out of Hueco.  This problem has recently broken.  The good left hand that you go out to from the start now rests in three pieces at the bottom of the problem.  Lame.  I suspect that the problem is now V12 or so.
content.location: 75 yards to the west of Scary Monsters.  Begins on an obvious crimp rail followed by two others.

content.description: Start seated just to the right of Scary Monsters on good crimps. move up to the sidepull crimp rail and then gain the arete. Climb the arete staying on the left side.
content.location: On the Scary Monsters boulder atop the cliff band above Big Joe.

content.description: Despite the fact that it's caked in chalk and generally has a crowd around it on a busy day, this is a fun dynamic roof problem.  Follow the flake system to a fun crux, and finish on the two decent holds near the end of the cave.
content.location: The middle of the big roof on the Big Joe boulder.

content.description: Start matched on the right side of the slopey, hueco like feature. Figure out your feet and move out right hand to a choice of pockets and crimps. Set yourself up and throw, big, for the slopey top. Mantle over.
content.location: On the boulder just above the Big Joe boulder. There is a distinct hueco like feature on the corner. As per the guidebook, two other problems rated at v3 are on the boulder.

content.description:
Burly, burly, burly.  Start standing with both hands matched on undercling. Pull on (maybe the crux) then shoot right hand up to a small crimp. Readjust then go again with your right to the sloper.  Top out.

-note- top of boulder can be grainy/sandy. Check it out beforehand and clean/brush if needed.
content.protection: The landing is flat and the boulder is not that high. One pad should do it.
content.location: From the Big Joe area the boulder is right across the gully and slightly uphill.  The start holds are on the right side of the boulder at the blunt arret. Very obvious line.
